Thanks Jason. I didn't know there was extra code that prevented the functio=
ns for input nodes from being run. 

Glad to hear the raw inputs are availa=
ble to the network. That is what makes sense to me. 

Best regards,
Jeff Cl=
une

Cornell University

On Oct 9, 2012, at 11:40 PM, Jason Gauci <jgmath2000@...> wrote:=


> Actually upon looking at it again, what I said earlier isn't the case.
=
> 
> 
> When you create a FastNetwork, it sets numConstantNodes, which defi=
nes all nodes in the range [0,numConstantNodes) to be input nodes.  Then it=
 only runs the activation function on nodes in the range [numConstantNodes,=
inf).
> 
> Let me know if there is a bug in that logic, but it looks like t=
he input nodes should not have an activation function called on them.
> 
> =
Jason G.
> 
>
